:bulb:Give dev access to some global variables of the environment (portal) to do some magic tricks:male_mage: within the drag&drop, example:
`${tag}` in `widget-wrapper.snippet` (so we can get rid of `span` as wrappers and use properly some HTML5 tags.

Also could be really cool let us edit default modules so we can overwrite a lot of stuff to something more useful and optimised for each project.

This should/could be really nice to be attached to themes too so we can suggest a config-env.json with this bunch of changes.

Possible issues between marketplace modules if they use selectors like `span.my-class` but all of my projects just use internal modules and themes, so this will definitely not be an issue and we will win a huge amount of freedom to customise each project without loosing the drag&drop

the editing default modules(we kind of have this because we can clone them and edit the clones)

agree completely on being able to change the span wrappers
Yeah, that's what I do basically. But you end with a dirty and big list of CMs, I would like to hide at least the default CM :grin:

My vote - The ability to toggle off the availability of the default CMs using the toggle thats up here(currently disabled for HS modules)
<https://spin.d.pr/IqaEkN+>

I completely get what you are saying Gonzalo about being able to change em and the mess it creates having multiple versions of modules in the listings.

I do think though there is some sanity to having the HS modules only be editable by HS(that way they work consistently across portals, and you know as a dev if you put in a normal rich text module it’s gonna do what it always does)

So I think being able to toggle off their visibility is the best solution.
Agree, as simplest solution for default modules. But my main concern is about the span wrappers :joy:
totally agree with being able to change the span wrappers. would love that.

And same use case for the functionality :
Use section, header, nav... tags
If we could edit the ${tag} var of the environment in the CM we could do a global module use the header or footer tag
Will be better tho, use the header on the . header-container-wrapper for example
It would be fab if we could open "Edit" buttons in a new tab. This would be great for bulk editing blog posts :slightly_smiling_face:
God dammit. Can you tell I'm new to developing on a Mac? :joy:

you could also use this tool for bulk changes (haven’t used it myself):

<https://www.articulatemarketing.com/hubtoolkit>

I’ve been working using macs for about 6+ years (normally a windows user for personal use) the keyboard shortcuts still baffle me.

I mean look at all these rediculous symbols that get used instead of words or abbreviations like CMD or ALT or CTRL: <https://www.danrodney.com/mac/>

For the blog dashboard, can we get the author name added in next to the Status of the blog? I know its possible to add this as a column but i feel like limiting it to just 2 additional columns makes it hard as ideally all four of those columns are important when reviewing blogs or trying to find a blog from someone quickly
